intro: Cordia vargasii, commonly known as the Mexican white cedar, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale blue, followed by woody, spherical fruits. Cordia vargasii is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
